item.title: Workflows: getting unknown error when making a request to HubSpot API. "at null.search (file:///tmp/ee/c_N2fM6el/index.mjs:292:9)"

item.description:

at null.search (file:///tmp/ee/c_N2fM6el/index.mjs:292:9)

    at global.executeComponent (/var/task/launch_worker.js:154:22)

Any idea what this error means?

Thanks,
Lar

item.title: Combining Custom HTTP Request Step + Proxy
item.dc:creator: seagalli
item.description:
We have a basic test pipeline working HTTP Trigger + Request Step + Custom Response Output but we will need to feed all of our requests through a Proxy service to get a static IP. Is there a way to easily combine the Custom Request Step with the Proxy step in a straightforward way?

The benefit of the Custom Request step is that it makes setting up new endpoints/API requests very simple and our proxy information will not change.

Thanks in advance.

item.title: Zoom Meeting -> Telegram
item.dc:creator: quasimonto
item.description:
Hi there,

i am trying to get a simple workflow going.
I want to send a message to a telegram channel once i open my zoom meeting.

i added my zoom account and in the account scope i can see pipedream has these rights
chat_channel:readchat_channel:writechat_contact:readchat_message:readchat_message:writemeeting:readmeeting:writepac:readpac:writephone:readphone:writerecording:readrecording:writeuser:readuser:writeuser_profilewebinar:readwebinar:write

I then created the source and set the trigger to meeting.started. Testing the trigger does not work because it seems that no event is recieved or no event sent althou i tried several times to open a meeting.

I see an error in the log file but cant really do anything with it.

TypeError: Cannot destructure property 'object' of 'payload' as it is undefined.
at Object.run (file:///var/task/user/sources/meeting-started/meeting-started.mjs:22:13)
at /var/task/index.js:123:72
at async captureObservations (/var/task/node_modules/@lambda-v2/component-runtime/src/captureObservations.js:28:5)
at async Runtime.exports.main [as handler] (/var/task/index.js:61:20)

Do i have to have a payed Zoom account for that to work? What else do it miss here?

Thanks for any help

item.title: Source: Reset emitted events or manually trigger a workflow that is triggered by a source
item.dc:creator: lharney
item.description:
Hey,

I’ve created a source that triggers a workflow and it works well.

Is it possible to reset the emitted events from the source or to manually trigger the workflows?
The reason I ask is that when I upload the source, the source makes a request to the external API before the workflow is created. This means that any events emitted by the source, before the workflow is created, does not trigger the workflow.

Thanks,
Lar

item.title: Pipedream can't find Stripe test events when setting up Stripe to Mailerlite Workflow
item.dc:creator: nathantrevivian
item.description:
Hello,

I’m trying to setup pipedream to link a stripe webhook to a mailerlite subscription.
I’m setting up the workflow, have connected stripe and selected the event I care about, and I’m trying to trigger an event from stripe so that I can move onto the next step.

I’ve installed the stripe cli using homebrew and have run:

stripe listen --forward-connect-to https://REDACTED.m.pipedream.net

where https://REDACTED.m.pipedream.net is the webhook endpoint.

Then I’m using the stripe cli to trigger an event:

stripe trigger charge.succeeded

I can see this in the logs:

2022-02-21 11:04:28   --> charge.succeeded [evt_3KVZguJkl2z7Ianr18WAzM3R]

But when I click the Test button on the workflow setup it just says it couldn’t find any events:

I sort of need this step to work so I can configure the mailerlite bit - I’m assuming it’ll use the event data to pull out a list of fields I can use to configured mailerlite call (ie: the email address).

What am I doing wrong? How can I trigger a test event from stripe so that this pipedream workflow setup will continue?

Thanks for any help!

3 posts - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Pipedream can't find Stripe test events when setting up Stripe to Mailerlite Workflow

item.title: Manual WP Trigger to Create New Thread in Discord
item.dc:creator: keelydunn
item.description:
Describe your needs and project in details.

I’m looking for code/plugin that I can use on every post of a CPT where users can click a button and it triggers a Discord webhook to create a new thread in a specific channel with that CPT’s title and URL. P.S. this is way above my skillset so if I’m describing it poorly, apologies.

What services or apps do you need to integrate?
Wordpress + Discord

What steps should this workflow take?
Copies CPT title and URL → creates new thread in Discord channel with CPT title as thread title and URL pasted as first post in thread

What should trigger this workflow?
User-activated manual trigger (e.g. button)

Any more details that are important for a Pipedream Expert to know?

Read full topic
